summary: Storage for actor information (first name, last name). Use to identify actors in films.
Address details for customers, staff, and stores. Contains street, district, and phone.
Film categories (genres) like Action, Comedy, Horror. Use to classify films.
City names and their associated country_id. Part of the address hierarchy.
Country names. Top level of the address hierarchy.
Primary user/customer table. Contains profiles, email, active status, and address linkage. Use for ranking customers or filtering by status.
Main catalog of films/movies. Contains title, description, release year, rating (G, PG, etc.), rental details, and length.
Junction table linking Films to Actors. Use to find which actors played in which film.
Junction table linking Films to Categories. Use to filter films by genre.
Physical inventory of film copies at specific stores. Links Films to Stores. Essential for rental availability.
Financial transactions. Records payments made by customers for rentals. Contains amount and payment_date. Use for calculating revenue or spending.
Rental history. Records when a customer rented an inventory item and when it was returned. Links Customer, Inventory, and Staff.
Employee information. Links staff to specific stores.
Physical store locations. Links address and manager (staff).
